intro: Nototriche digitulifolia, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests and alpine meadows. Its flowers bloom in late summer and early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Nototriche digitulifolia is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable climatic conditions.
